content:
That's a great approach!

Starting with the intro version of Ableton Live is a fantastic way to get your feet wet and learn the basics of music production. You'll be able to explore the software, learn the interface, and develop your skills without breaking the bank.

As you mentioned, having a background in guitar playing and experimenting with electronic sounds will definitely help you dive in more quickly. You'll be able to apply your musical knowledge and translate it into the digital realm.

Remember, the most important thing is to have fun and be creative! Don't be afraid to experiment, try new things, and make mistakes. It's all part of the learning process, and you'll be surprised at how quickly you'll pick up the skills.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm always here to help. Good luck, and I hope you have a blast producing some amazing music with Ableton Live!
